page.title: 02A FAMILY BEEF FARM
page.content: This is a 250 acre beef farm, breeding just Charolais cattle. Meadow Mell Farm is covered by grassland with buildings at the side nearest the A336 road. One building is for keeping machinery including tractors, bailer and a bulldozer. These are all the property of the Coombes family who also own the farm. In view of high costs and other expenses involved no outside labour is employed and the farm can easily be managed by the members of the same family. This is evident as all the machinery is modern thereby avoiding the need to employ extra men to work on the farm. Additional income is made from selling the 100 tonnes of cow dung produced every year by the farm stock of cows.
